marketNews.title: OPEC+ Will Postpone Planned Production Increase
marketNews.content: OPEC+ delegates have stated that the organization is getting closer to an agreement to postpone the planned increase in oil production of 180 thousand barrels per day (bpd) by three months, which was previously scheduled to start in January 2025. This plan is an effort by OPEC+ to maintain oil supply amidst still weak oil prices (Brent) hovering around the level of ~$70 per barrel (-2.5% YTD). Brent prices even briefly touched a level below 70 US dollars per barrel last September (10/9), marking the lowest level since the end of 2023. The formal decision is scheduled to be made on Thursday (5/12). OPEC+ itself has undertaken various efforts to support oil prices. In total, OPEC+ has implemented production cuts of 5.86 million bpd - equivalent to 5.7% of global demand - since 2022. These cuts consist of voluntary cuts of 2.2 million bpd and production cuts of 3.66 million bpd. Initially, OPEC+ planned to start gradually reducing voluntary cuts in October 2024. However, this plan was postponed for two months, or until December 2024, due to weakening oil prices. Despite the plan to postpone the planned production increase, total OPEC+ production is still expected to increase in 2025. In June 2024, OPEC+ agreed on a production increase plan for the United Arab Emirates (UAE) of 300 thousand bpd gradually starting in January 2025. Additionally, Kazakhstan also has plans to expand the Tengiz oil field, which potentially increases its oil production. Following the news of the production postponement, Brent prices strengthened by more than +2% in Tuesday's (3/12) trading and rose slightly again by +0.2%, nearing the level of 74 US dollars per barrel today (4/12). Driven by this positive sentiment, the share prices of oil and gas producers such as MEDC (+5.6%) and ENRG (+3.4%) strengthened in today's trading. Key Takeaway: We assess that OPEC+'s commitment to maintaining oil prices by continuously postponing the reduction of production cuts has the potential to keep oil prices on the downside. However, the challenging outlook for China's economic recovery and limited US economic growth potential - which are the two largest oil-consuming countries in the world - could limit the upside for oil prices. Therefore, we expect oil prices to be relatively stable in the range of 70-80 US dollars per barrel in the medium term. According to Valaris - one of the global oil drilling service providers - this oil price level is still considered profitable for oil producers, so exploration interest is likely to remain sustained.

marketNews.title: EXCL CEO Resigns Ahead of Merger with FREN
marketNews.content: EXCL: XL Axiata announced that Dian Siswarini has submitted a letter of resignation from her position as President Director of the company on December 3, 2024. EXCL explained that Dian's resignation was due to personal reasons. Dian's resignation will be effective upon approval in the General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPS), the date of which has not yet been announced. Dian's resignation occurs amidst the company's merger plan with Smartfren Telecom (FREN), where Dian stated in October 2024 that the corporate action could be completed by the end of 2024. PTPP: PT PP through its subsidiary, PT PP Infrastruktur, announced that it has sold its entire ownership (99.3%) stake in PT Ultra Mandiri Telekomunikasi for 645.5 billion rupiah to Dayamitra Telekomunikasi (MTEL). This transaction is part of PTPP's asset divestment plan totaling 1 trillion rupiah throughout 2024, aimed at reducing the company's long-term debt which reached 11.31 trillion rupiah as of 3Q24. PT Ultra Mandiri Telekomunikasi is engaged in the telecommunications infrastructure sector, specifically fiber optics. HRUM: Harum Energy through its subsidiary, PT Tanito Harum Nickel (THN), announced that it has subscribed to approximately 4 million new shares issued by PT Harum Nickel Industry (HNI), an HRUM business entity in nickel mining investment. The transaction constitutes the implementation of the conversion of HNI's entire debt to THN amounting to 4.2 trillion rupiah or 266.3 million US dollars. After this transaction, THN's ownership in HNI remains at 99.99%. This corporate action is intended to strengthen HNI's capital structure to realize the company's long-term business diversification strategy. TBIG: Tower Bersama Infrastructure will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year of 25 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiated markets is December 11, 2024, with payment on December 27, 2024. Referring to TBIG's stock price at the close of trading on Wednesday (4/11) at 1,945 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 1.3%. TPIA: Chandra Asri Pacific Director, Andre Khor Kah Hin, purchased 148,600 TPIA shares at an average price of 6,733 rupiah per share on November 28, 2024. The total transaction value reached 1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Andre Khor Kah Hin's ownership in TPIA increased from none to 0.00017%. AVIA: Avia Avian Director, Ruslan Tanoko, purchased approximately 8.3 million AVIA shares at an average price of 422 rupiah per share on November 26, 2024. The total transaction value reached 3.5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Ruslan's ownership in AVIA increased from 0.0474% to 0.0609%. EAST: Eastparc Hotel will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 14.4 billion rupiah or 3.5 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiated markets is December 12, 2024, with payment on December 27, 2024. Referring to EAST's stock price at the close of trading on Wednesday (4/11) at 110 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 3.2%. This is the 3rd interim dividend from EAST after distributing an interim dividend of 1.5 rupiah per share in June 2024 and 1.25 rupiah per share in October 2024. BREN: Barito Renewables Energy will distribute an interim dividend for the 2024 fiscal year amounting to 506.2 billion rupiah or 3.78 rupiah per share. The cum date in the regular and negotiated markets is December 11, 2024, with payment on December 20, 2024. Referring to BREN's stock price at the close of trading on Wednesday (4/11) at 7,475 rupiah per share, the indicative dividend yield is 0.05%.

marketNews.title: Government to Confirm VAT Hike Next Week Amid Calls for Postponement
marketNews.content: The Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs, Airlangga Hartarto, stated on Tuesday (3/11) that the government will confirm the increase in the Value Added Tax (VAT) rate from 11% to 12% next week. If implemented, this VAT rate increase will take effect on January 1, 2025. Previously, business circles and labor unions had urged the government to postpone the VAT rate hike, considering the deteriorating economy. In addition to the VAT rate, Airlangga also said that the government would announce fiscal stimulus to support labor-intensive industries, which have been hit by a wave of layoffs due to slowing global demand growth.

marketNews.title: Investment Minister: Apple Offers USD 1 Billion Investment in Latest Bid to Sell iPhone 16 in Indonesia
marketNews.content: The Minister of Investment, Rosan Roeslani, stated that his office has received an investment offer of 1 billion US dollars from Apple Inc. (Nasdaq: AAPL), in the tech giant's latest effort to sell the iPhone 16 series in Indonesia. This amount is a 100-fold jump compared to Apple's initial investment offer of 10 million US dollars in early November 2024, and comes after the government rejected an investment offer of 100 million US dollars last week. Rosan mentioned that the government hopes to receive the investment commitment letter within 1 week. Previously, the Minister of Industry, Agus Gumiwang Kartasasmita, stated in November 2024 that his main priority was to get Apple to open a factory in Indonesia, similar to the practice adopted by other smartphone manufacturers such as Samsung Electronics Co. and Xiaomi Corp.

marketNews.title: Bank Indonesia Ready to Intervene in FX Market as Rupiah Nears IDR 16,000/$
marketNews.content: The Head of the Monetary Management and Securities Asset Department of Bank Indonesia, Edi Susianto, stated on Wednesday (4/11) that the central bank is ready to intervene in the currency market to stabilize the rupiah, which is currently approaching the psychological level of 16,000 per US dollar. Edi's comment came after the rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar weakened by -0.2% to the level of 15,968 in early Wednesday (4/11) trading, relatively underperforming compared to other Asian currencies. The rupiah exchange rate against the US dollar has approached the 16,000 psychological level for the second time in the last 1 month. Bank Indonesia previously stated that the fundamental level of the rupiah is stronger than 16,000 per US dollar.

marketNews.title: EU Approves 12-Month Delay for Deforestation Law Implementation
marketNews.content: The European Union on Tuesday (3/11) approved a 12-month postponement for the implementation of the anti-deforestation law until December 30, 2025, although without discarding the content of the applicable rules. Previously, Bloomberg reported in November 2024 that the European Parliament had proposed further changes to the regulation content to make the rules softer. The EU's anti-deforestation regulation is a milestone in the fight against the climate crisis, but developing countries such as Brazil and Indonesia argue that the rules are protectionist. The European Union is Indonesia's fourth largest export market and contributed 11.5% of Indonesia's total CPO exports in 2023.

marketNews.title: China Bans Exports of Critical Minerals to the US Following Chip Restrictions
marketNews.content: China's Ministry of Commerce announced on Tuesday (3/11) a ban on the export of several critical minerals to the US, consisting of gallium, germanium, antimony, and superhard materials. The Chinese government also announced it would impose stricter controls on graphite exports to the US. This move follows the US government imposing restrictions earlier this week on the sale of high-bandwidth memory chips to China to slow down China's semiconductor and artificial intelligence development that could aid its military.

marketNews.title: Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources Launches Auction for 6 Oil and Gas Blocks
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources launched an auction for 6 oil and gas (migas) blocks on Tuesday (3/11), bringing the total number of migas blocks offered in 2024 to 11. The blocks offered on Tuesday (3/11) were the Air Komering, Serpang, Kojo, Binaiya, Gaea, and Gaea II blocks, with total potential migas reserves of 48 billion barrels of oil equivalent. The government aims to increase oil and gas exploration to find new hydrocarbon reserves amidst declining production from old blocks.

marketNews.title: Secretary of the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs to Expedite Declassification of Protected Forest Status for PANI's Tropical Coastland PSN
marketNews.content: The Secretary of the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Susiwijono Moegiarso, stated that they will immediately realize the release of protected forest status for land included in Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua's (PANI) Tropical Coastland National Strategic Project (PSN). Previously, the Minister of Agrarian Affairs and Spatial Planning/Head of the National Land Agency, Nusron Wahid, mentioned that the Tropical Coastland PSN has several problems, one of which is that 1,500 hectares of the total ~1,700 hectares of land in the project is protected forest area. Susiwijono also mentioned that his office will facilitate discussions between the Ministry of Forestry and PANI to discuss this matter.

marketNews.title: IDX to Release New Auto Rejection Limits for Conventional Warrants
marketNews.content: Kontan reported that the IDX will release auto rejection provisions for company warrants (conventional warrants). Currently, auto rejection for conventional warrants occurs if the bid price or buy demand entered into JAST is equal to or exceeds the last trading price of its underlying stock. Following the establishment of the new regulation, there will be several new provisions regarding the application of auto rejection for conventional warrants: 1) warrant price equals or exceeds the last trading price of the underlying stock; 2) more than 10 rupiah for warrants with a price range of 1-9 rupiah per share; 3) more than 50% above or below the reference price for warrants with a price range of 10-200 rupiah per share; 4) more than 40% above or below the reference price for warrants with a price range above 200-5,000 rupiah per share; and 5) more than 30% above or below the reference price for warrants priced above 5,000 rupiah per share. The IDX has not announced when this rule change will take effect.
